aZ8ukSyv-kiwWvFHgXggeA.text: I'm really torn on this place. It's obviously a popular restaurant, the menu is really funny, and their drinks are delicious. But their service is awful if you come any time that they're remotely busy. The last time we were there, It took our server forever to get to us. We placed a drink order and it took almost 15 minute to get them out. By the time the server came to take our dinner order we had already decided to leave for somewhere else. It was the second time in a row this had happened to us, and after the second time trying Ruru's I'd rather spend my time somewhere else.

D-FUAtgKKOlmRTHWVi20dA.text: 5 stars on there food but 3 stars for there workers We come here a lot, the food is great. On the other hand the hosts of tonight was really rude because the sitting are extremely close. I asked to go on their patio instead of sitting too close to another person. As I was walking outside I spotted a area inside that needed cleaning but waited to wait, so she came back in and started talking about us because as soon as we look up there's 3 people looking at us funny. Other then that i love this restaurant just so many new faces every time and the workers need to learn manners. Okkkurrr

photos.caption: Photo of RuRu's Tacos + Tequila - Charlotte, NC, United States

4jcb4P7iYruGBGRgak0vzg.text: One of the best patios in town, RuRu's is a great place to spend a summer afternoon outdoors. The margarita and drinks menu is top notch, beer selection is fairly extensive, and we've never had a bad appetizer. The "street" tacos are inexpensive and show great variety and uniqueness. Their fajitas are great (recommend mixing shrimp, chicken and steak, for a minimal upcharge), and they will double the meat for a small price increase. The service here is a little hands-off once you receive your food/drinks, but otherwise attentive and fast to place orders and bring beverages/food. The decor is super chill, feels very much like "old Mexico"; lots of dark wood and terracotta tile. Love the communal benches in the main room, similar to a taproom. We recently had a company event in their private room, which is great for parties of 8 to 12 (maybe more?), and received perfect service and food.  The parking is confusing until you realize there's a huge lot in back, though it is often full. The place swings on weekends, expect a wait.  Downside: sometimes on weekends or evenings they have live musicians on the patio, and they set them up by the open door to the host stand, it can make the entire place a bit loud, inside and out, and the acoustics suck - so it's not even that enjoyable.   Absent the musicians, this place is a solid 5 Stars, and we return regularly. Apparently we're not alone, as we have seen local sports superstars and recognizable Hollywood stars here as well.

YtHRz0nz44J51SOOk_4nfg.text: (more like 3.5 stars)  Went here on a recent Saturday evening and walked away stuffed. We showed up around 7 p.m. and the parking situation was a little gnarly but, thankfully, there were spots available on the green patch of grass that's a little further down from their paved lot.  Since it was a beautiful night out, we chose to sit outside at the bar. There was no wait so we grabbed a couple of seats and were greeted promptly. We started out with a margarita (me) and beer on draft (for him). We also ordered guacamole and salsa for our appetizers. The chips are very hearty, just wish they had a little more seasoning/salt.  For our main entrees, I went with the get off my lawn taco and it's all ball bearings rice bowl. He went with the Clarence beeks steak burrito and lookin good Louis taco. My bowl was massive and I ended up having it for three more meals later on in the week (big plus!) The taco was excellent, right amount of heat and flavorful.  I think for my next visit, I'll focus more on the tacos since that's what they're known for.

photos.caption: Photo of RuRu's Tacos + Tequila - Charlotte, NC, United States. Get off my lawn shrimp taco on the left, friend zone house Margarita in the middle, and chicken rice bowl on the right
Photo of RuRu's Tacos + Tequila - Charlotte, NC, United States. It&#39;s all ball bearings grilled chicken rice bowl

ehenQGW2lhbndZM43BEB5g.text: I swore I'd never go back but a friend wanted to go for her birthday so I got sucked into the group-thing. I tried to accept with a fresh frame of mind.  I knew better than to order a Margarita this time as orange juice margs don't do it for me, so a simple glass of wine was fine. We ordered queso for the table. Tasteless and runny.  No one raved about their dinners and lots went back when the table was cleared. I got a taco that I ate because I was quite hungry at the end of the workday, but anything would have done the trick. Please close this place so another better restaurant can take over this great patio space.

pnTShiuvIy_5H-67aFJlnA.text: The food and service was ok. The worst thing about the whole experience was that after waiting for a table for more than 40 mins., they sat us by the bathrooms where the smell was horrible and when asked to be seated at the empty booth across from the table we were at, the hostess said they were reserving it for a bigger party! I ordered some tacos which didn't come with any sauce so I asked for a side of salsa not knowing that it would be a $1.50 extra. I think the server should have mentioned it. We might come back to give it another shot but this place is not on the top of my list.

VfhS4kcZQ8DeXmSKhsgJvw.text: The location is the only special thing about this place. They have a great patio and nice interior. The drinks and food are just average, at best. Beer selection isn't great and our waitress couldn't even tell us half the draft selections. We got a, "Uh... there's a pumpkin beer. I'm not sure where it's from." All the food was very bland.

u3ED6lDfaNAO_hs6XD6JLA.text: It was Taco Tuesday so I ordered a couple of tacos and they were good.  The food is Amercan/Mexican but as good if not better than the other Mexican restaurants I have been to in town. The best thing about the place is the outdoor seating and the tequila.  It is a great spot for dinner and drinks with friends.

_lYTPPVsrW9qgIQUXBw4Og.text: Service was awesome.  Food was awesome.  Good beer selection and creative cocktails.   outaide patio and bar will be fun on my next visit.

RtdZ4Vfg6OtEfc99PC1Vgw.text: Tacos are descent. Portion size for Jasmine rice and Vegetarian black beans very disappointing because it was less than a cup portion and cost $3.50 each. Atmosphere and manager in red shirt was not welcoming or friendly. Place is not very diverse either. I will not be returning. There are far more better places to eat in Uptown.

438xQt1Nq9WH3fIZ4H3N5g.text: Good food, good drinks, great little outdoor patio.  I can easily eat 4 of their tacos.  But can someone please tell me how they can charge for chips and salsa!?  I've never been to a Mexican place that does this, except for Chipotle, which doesn't really count.

wxoOZ0jP_7HwO-cfTWdcBg.text: This place was so awesome I came home tonight and immediately opened my computer to share the wealth. I first heard about this little strangely named taco joint on Cinco de Mayo. All the cool kids were doing it, but the wait was THREE HOURS. Tell me, who the hell waits three hours for tacos?! I was not about to play that game. But a non-assuming Monday night for a friend's birthday? YEP. I'll start by saying RuRu's needs better signage out front. The parking is a bit confusing, but just go around back (that is NOT what she said). After you actually find the restaurant it is stunning! A lovely patio, wooden bar, antique with a touch of modern. Very, very cool. While I'm talking about decor, I will also mention that the artwork (allisonsprockfineart.com) was so cool that I texted pictures of it to my friends and the music had me singing almost every tune. Very laid-back vibe, in an upbeat way - if that makes sense? THE FOOD First, we got a kick out of reading the menu. All the dishes have one-liner names. I ordered the Alliteration something Louis, which means shrimp tacos with a side of the Tuscan white beans. Mostly I ordered the white beans because I just worked out, was super hungry, and was afraid that two tacos wouldn't fill me up. But let me just preach really quick - I would have eaten a serving bowl of those freaking beans. I have no idea how the hell they did that but the beans had a creamy tomato sauce with a hint of lemon. Sounds weird, but wow wow wow. The beans are pretty much the reason I'm even writing this review at all. We got the three amigos (or something) appetizer, that had guac, salsa and queso and everyone was raving about how good the guac was. It was fresh and chunky with the perfect compliment of tomato, onion and seasoning. Plus, warm chips (shiver). One girl got the Korean Taco, which sounded like it would be overwhelming, but it was really, really good. I will probably get that next time. I also heard great things about the mahi mahi. Actually, now that I think about it, no one had a complaint the entire time. We all agreed that RuRu's puts Cabo and Bakersfield to shame a little - sorry guys! DRINKS There are specials every night, and the cocktail list was impressive. They are $9.75/each, which could get pricey. But the specials and the beer list were on par. SERVICE As a waitress, there is something intimidating about seating 6 girls. I know this because I did it for years. Our waitress was excellent and had really hot white/purple hair (not important, but still worth noting). She gave us all great suggestions and was nice enough to help us split the bill at the end which is always a pain. OVERALL Overall RuRu's is fab! It would be a perfect romantic date spot or girls night out. It's fun and delicious and I can't wait to go back.

wkzUzH7-BaA0DhZfrbodnw.text: Train wreck part deux.  Wow. 2 of our friends ordered "The Snowflake", which is supposed to have tofu in it, and got Lamb instead. All of the tacos come in flour tortillas, not good if you are gluten free like my wife is. And no warning on the menu. Lastly, shots of Tito's vodka is 9 bucks. Each. It was obvious to me as a Chef, that nobody really cared about the food that was being sent out. Seasoning went from overly aggressive, to none at all. The only reason I gave 2 stars is I will go back and sit on the patio and eat their fresh fried corn chips and guacamole on the awesome patio.

xwg8JyMngjU4xmItjj1N2A.text: A carnivore, seafood lover and vegetarian walk into a taco shop...and all leave happy! This place was delicious! Loved the atmosphere although we had trouble finding the entrance haha. Our server was attentive and had great suggestions for the tacos. I went with my mom and sister and we all enjoyed our meals. We started with chips and salsa, guac and queso. All three were a hit. I think we had almost every taco on the menu except the pork and salmon? The tacos are small and only a few bucks, so it's cheap to try a variety. Two filled us up with the appetizer although I was tempted to force a third because they were so good. Jeff, the bartender is awesome, so if you wanna hang at the bar and grab a bite, ask for him!

mW8XNb60-lPirAeOMfg1dQ.text: Not the best! My group ordered a variety of dips, tacos and margaritas. The margaritas and guacamole were good, but the tacos weren't the greatest. I tried the pork belly, mahi mahi, and the shrimp tacos. All of which didn't have the best flavor. I would definitely recommend for guacamole and margs but not tacos!

6wRu2u1y6cW9Pzza66LI0A.text: First of all, I want to start by saying "good job" with the menu. Their entrees are all named after movies. It actually made me laugh. Another thing that made me chuckle; $4.00 (or$4.25) for a single taco. Anyway, started with the chips and queso. The queso was good, but it was a bit runny. I guess I prefer mine so it actually stays on the chip. For my entree I got the "stage 5 clinger", the "long duk dong" and the "I'll have what she's having."  The long duk dong, which was a Korean style steak taco, was the clear winner in the group. It had the most meat and most flavor of my trio. Now, the "I'll have what she's having?"  Totally underwhelming. It came with a tiny strip of dry mahi mahi that I would be embarrassed to serve. Seriously, the avocado slice was bigger than the fish.   Between the movie references and the creative tacos, I wanted to love this place, but I feel like it just missed the mark. With a few minor tweaks, I really think I could love it.   The server was terrific though.

irdwgU9HhAqY83EzxJO89A.text: Great marguerita and a friendly bar team. Tacos were on point and guacamole was good. I'd recommend a visit.

Ey7vWZT66rw7nP2i-wbOTw.text: My dad and I go get tacos every weekend and when I heard about RuRu's I knew it had to be our next spot. We went on Sunday for lunch and it was the perfect time, not too crowded and attentive service.  First thing, the menu is riddled with movie quotes and characters and it took us 10 minutes just laughing at all the famous lines before we even started looking at what each one actually was. We started with the Three Amigos, salsa, guac and queso. The salsa was amazing and fire roasted but the real winner here was the guac, it had so much flavor and I couldn't get enough! We were both drawn to the Friend Zone margarita which was refreshing with the orange juice and lime juice, so  naturally we ordered two rounds.   Finally and most importantly the tacos. The "Long Duk Dong" was a favorite, korean beef was tender and so flavorful. "Fat Guy in a Little Coat" was also a great taco with the grilled skirt steak. There are so many more tacos on the menu and I want to try them all. Can't wait for my next visit to RuRu's!

9c9yesz2P0ny7R2xzBolUg.text: Unique Mediterranean Venue with a lot of seating inside and nice outside area. Address may lead you to the back of the building, but just follow the signs and you will find it. Tacos were delicious!

iSTpRDxQt_gtqEq_lvum3A.text: Disappointed with the flavor (or lack thereof) with the food I ordered. The quesadilla was bland, as was the guacamole (which seemed to be nothing more than chopped up vegetables). I ended up taking the guac home and flavoring it myself. Their salsa and queso was decent but nothing special.

vfsEU7f-7cFIX3HdebMo0Q.text: Really, really good. I was trolling the internet looking for good tacos in Charlotte and I found this little gem. You'd never know it was there if you weren't specifically looking for it. I drive past it every day twice on my way to work and back. $4 per taco is on par with other major cities like Austin or Dallas so it really wasn't any more expensive. Portion size is also pretty standard. I had "You're going the wrong way", "Stage Five Clinger", "Fat Guy in a little coat" and "It was the dukes". I'll be back for sure and next time I'll eat in.

PT4Gg8KTXBFjxU22hvFo5g.text: We love RuRu's! It's our go-to. The atmosphere is great, the food is so good! I always get the rice bowl! The menu is hysterical. When it's nice out, I suggest sitting outside on the patio. It's very pretty and there's a bar outside. I'm all about their local craft beers!

vjRLBoXrLVt29DkRE3Y72w.text: Much better experience this go round. Bartender was attentive yet not hovering to much. I had one of their salads with chicken and it was good. We also had the Three Amigos appetizer-guac, salsa, cheese dip with chips. Pretty good although I wish one of them had some heat. Friend had a chicken rice bowl and said it was really good. Beers specials--$2.75 for certain bottled beer. Will return and try their tacos next time. Also seemed to have a decent selection of beers on tap (not really a beer drinker personally) and I noted a nice selection of tequila.

9wdkKcPOS24yQ2c1CFRz2A.text: Finally a great Mexican restaurant in Charlotte! First one, combination of awesome ambiance, delicious food with a little bit of modern and also authentic fair.  Love love- don't forget to sit outside in the awesome patio

yc3JpViUJjuE5XalAvDTDA.text: The restaurant was a little hard to find from the back but the patio has a great atmosphere and is pet friendly. The frozen margarita was extra cold and perfect for a summer night. A great spot for date night or a big group of friends.

-Xk3mZ7w-aH0k9mYPjIm4w.text: Over priced and flavorless vegan options. Is unfortunate, because the patio nice and a 5 min walk from my place. Plenty of other options in the neighborhood.

HAcIMPrJhP8dLPU-7nth6w.text: This place was wonderful! I shared Frank the Tank with my bro and it left us with such a buzz! The service was great and the food followed suit! Our server was really sweet and the burrito was super tasty! Def add the hot sauce but on the side since it is really spicy! The location and decor added to the great ambiance. We came during the week and parking was easy. Left very satisfied!

mqyPO7LRXhjZ89Q9Gdi-Kg.text: This place is super cute! I really enjoyed the food, I can't wait to go back. I got the stage five clinger and looking good louis tacos which were really delicious. Also, the queso is sooooo good. I've been twice & they have been really busy so the wait was pretty long but it's worth it.

IeoHzbgVJULPHEqo4OxdBw.text: What a hidden gem. Great food and great service. The menu items are all named after movies. Try the steak burrito! We will defiantly be back!

uFy26gnCRbY09c-DaIIs7g.text: Service and atmosphere fine, but majority of food items plain and average. If the audience is one seeking non -authentic chain-quality food, this makes it (not sure if it is even part of a larger group of restaurants- but the food seems geared for a non-discriminating suburban crowd).  The menu was interesting and cute but I wish they had spent the same amount of time developing a more flavorful group of foods. One exception was the wings appetizer which I felt was excellent and might be the only reason I'd return.   Main course of fajitas looked nice and the chicken was well-grilled but the accompanying peppers and onions seemed like they had been prepared earlier and were kept warm and soggy until time to use. This was probably the most flavorless serving of this dish I'd ever had. Needed seasoning and freshly grilled peppers and onions. No avocado provided (probably was for an extra price). Just a little grated American cheese and sour cream. Rice and beans served with this did not excite me.   Shrimp and chicken tacos ok but lacked flavor. Quesadillas were better.   Oh well. Try it and draw your own conclusions.

dWp6gFM7Hj9Ri8BJVN-QYA.text: First impression: RuRu's has a beautiful location, a lovely outdoor patio, and a wonderfully unique TexMex menu.   My husband and I walked from a nearby wine tasting Fri evening to check out RuRu's for our first time. There was a fairly long wait, but we didn't have to wait as long as expected.   The cocktail menu looked fun and beer menu wasn't too bad - there was a small selection of local drafts...would love to see more local craft options for sure.   For dinner, my husband opted for a burrito covered in queso and I ordered a strip steak and grilled mahi taco with a side of the creamy white beans. The food arrived quite quickly and looked great. As far as actual taste/quality/value, I was disappointed. The steak was rather tough, the tortillas were nothing unique and the contents of the tacos didn't quite fill them enough. The beans were tasty for sure and I can see why they are so popular.   Anyways, cool place and definitely worth a visit, but I think I'll stick with Paco's Tacos for their brisket tacos and Cabo Fish Taco for their delish fish tacos.

photos.caption: Photo of RuRu's Tacos + Tequila - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fat Guy in a Little Suit (skirt steak) &amp; I&#39;ll Have What She&#39;s Having (mahi) tacos with a side of (tangy) white beans.
Photo of RuRu's Tacos + Tequila - Charlotte, NC, United States. Burrito covered in queso. Tasty!

PqB3XjLH34-uJUp2sAO1sg.text: We sat on the patio on a beautiful Saturday for lunch. Get there a few minutes before noon because it got slammed quickly.  Parking isn't on Providence Road. It's in the back. Turn on Fenton, then look for the maroon and yellow sign.   We ordered the Billy Ray Valentine, the queso dip with chorizo, corn relish, pico de gallo, and cilantro. It was yummy.  I ordered the Uncle Buck taco, with fried oysters. I wolfed that down with no shame. I also ordered the Bueller quesadillas, but it was pretty plain.   I'd like to come back again on a weekend night because I'm sure it'll be fun. Nothin like a great patio and good food.

fzNnhUuj--8McMMDfl0ZZQ.text: Great outside patio area! Good margaritas, but mediocre food and very poor service from waitstaff! Drinks at the bar were great, bartender was wonderful! Once we were seated at our table it all went downhill.  Waitress was not friendly, not helpful, borderline rude...ie came and asked us if we were all done eating (our food had not even been delivered yet...she took the order...beyond odd). Several similar things happened through the the evening. Waited forever for entrees. Food was cold and bland once delivered, salad delivered without dressing. Great place to come for drinks and appetizers, but stick with the bartenders and skip the table service....and this was a week night.

photos.caption: Photo of RuRu's Tacos + Tequila - Charlotte, NC, United States

kKRTBHtU1zjUmUlGWsQz6A.text: The patio here is beautiful! The food is ok I got the lettuce cup salad which was bland so I don't recommend getting that.

photos.caption: Photo of RuRu's Tacos + Tequila - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lettuce cup salad

MN8JUAz9X-AlsgWcVsxj3Q.text: Ruru's tacos are one of my favorite in Charlotte, and the atmosphere just adds to how great this place actually is. It has been a go to for my friends and I for a while now, and the daily drink specials always have us trying something new. Unfortunately, the service the last two times I have dined at Ruru's has been an extreme damper on the night. About a month ago, I came in on a Saturday night with a group of three. We were sitting in a booth enjoying a second margarita after we had finished our tacos, and the MANAGER came over and said, "can I clear any of these plates out of your way? We have guests who have been waiting on a table for a while"..... This was completely unprofessional and made us feel very uncomfortable as he kept peering around the corner to see if we were getting up yet. Thursday night, I dined at Ruru's again, this time also with a group of 3. We enjoyed a beautiful night on the patio but our server seemed as if she hadn't slept in days. She didn't smile once, had zero emotion, and literally seemed as if she was moving in slow motion. She was incapable of explaining the drink special to us, and her only drink suggestion was a $16 shot of tequila. I sat and waited for a margarita as my friends drank theirs, and our waitress walked around aimlessly as if she had nothing to do. The food came out in a timely manner and as she brought it to the table, I told her I was still waiting on my drink. Her response was, "they're making it"...  Sadly these last two experiences have left me feeling different about what I have always considered a wonderful restaurant. I hate to see one of my favorite places in Charlotte go downhill, but the staff needs a serious wake up call! Maybe next time I will do a take-out order so I can still enjoy the delicious tacos, but not have to worry about the staff's lack of people-skills :)

FJsukk1eaJQhk7_gAd9EgA.text: RuRu's has awesome outdoor seating. If it's not raining, that's where I want to be seated. The whole area out there is just so pleasant, especially at night. It would be a great place to take a date. The inside seating is adequate, but go for the outdoor if given a choice.  If you like fancy drinks they have you covered. If you're a beer lover they don't really hold a candle to all of the places in Charlotte to get fine beer. One of my favorite drinks is the "You talkin' to me?" jalapeno margarita (better than Paco's).   Food-wise they have a pretty nice menu, a little short on veg options but it always tastes great and that's what matters. I usually get the "That's not snowflake" tacos with chipotle vinaigrette instead of the chipotle sauce (the sauce has cream in it). If I'm in the mood for eating a lot of food the "You Got No Legs, Lt. Dan" fills the belly quite nicely. Also, to there credit, they actually know how to cook tofu, which is rare for non-Asian places.  I definitely recommend trying out RuRu's. Get a seat outdoors if you can!

NMvoMcF6VU9Isg3p8mjjyw.text: Holy guacamole is this place good. Wow. First experience not one complaint. Queso. Guacamole and the chips are not just ordinary. Frozen margarita mhmmmm. Would deff go back. Exceptional service.

rt_WW1MkFxU2R3ARegeLzg.text: Best Mexican food in Charlotte! Always so fresh! Love the outdoor seating & patio bar.

VUKjvc7FHRyxWrO510ozGQ.text: I'm a huge fan of both Tacos and Tequila so I was stoked to finally hit RuRu's for dinner!    My bride and I went on a Thursday evening and had the Three Amigos trio (Salsa/Guacamole/Queso) and a couple margaritas for the first round.  We then dove into the 'It Was The Dukes", "Fat Guy in a Little Coat", "Looking Good Louis", and "Long Duk Dong".    Overall it was pretty good but I'd say a tick expensive for what you get.  Our bill with tip was over $80.  The Three Amigos trio was wonderful but enough for 4 people.  The "Looking Good Louis" was our favorite taco as the others seemed to lack seasoning and depth.  I wouldn't say they are the best taco option but if you are in that area and want a wonderful vibe with a great bar, give it a shot!  The margaritas are $9.75 but quite the upgrade if you want better tequila.  The shot of Don Julio Reposado was $14 so quite steep compared to other places like ... other local taco/tequila options.  I would rate 3.5 stars so I'll round up and visit again for final thoughts.

KIzA3OOsi5YKTsSW91DZlg.text: Hands down best margaritas in Charlotte. Go on Monday for $5 margs or Tuesday for a special taco flavor. So delicious, I love this place

AFv4gyHYktqRtWpr5bNYBw.text: My husband and I came here on a Friday night and the food was amazing the first time! We raved about it and had some friends meet us here for a second time and it was the absolute worst!!! The rice in my burrito was very crunchy... The steak was not seasoned and the food was not hot at all! The salsa was not good like it was the first time. We never came back! Having to pay for chips and salsa major disappointment

E45y9B6KpCGK5bvtpqfpPg.text: Overall a terribly bad and disappointing experience. We came for lunch on a Friday afternoon and though the place was almost empty, the service was poor and slow and we barely made it back to work on time. We started with chips and queso, the chips were stale and the queso was bland. We had a total of 5 tacos between the two of us and we thought the steak taco was the best while the rest were not anything impressive. The mahi mahi was way over cooked and the tortillas seemed microwaved and like something from the grocery store. The lettuce on the tacos was soggy and seemed either old or also microwaved for some reason, regardless it was not fresh.  The one star for this place is really only for the ambiance on the patio, though some of the plants looked a little rough and the inside didn't seem particularly clean. Save your money and go to Cantina 1511 down the road for better food and service, plus complimentary chips and salsa.

CBwlpuYVcdi2PFTNIsuz6w.text: A girlfriend and I checked out this hidden gem this past Sunday! The patio is amazing and the umbrella's came in clutch when it started to sprinkle.  We missed the brunch menu this time so we'll have to come earlier next time but the food was still outstanding. I got a chicken quesadilla and my friend got two tacos. We also split chips n salsa & queso (which was to die for)  The drink selection is really where it's at though! With clever names inspired from cult movie classics and $5 drink specials daily, RuRu's is quickly becoming my new favorite Mexican spot! The only negative thing I have to say is that the service was a little slow --- but I also realize that we were the only table on a rainy Sunday afternoon and that we were seated out of view of the waitstaff. Regardless, I'll still be back!

photos.caption: Photo of RuRu's Tacos + Tequila - Charlotte, NC, United States. DRANKS.
Photo of RuRu's Tacos + Tequila - Charlotte, NC, United States. RuRu&#39;s!

3xGLZ2HyGbIVmJCNplJpxg.text: Great environment! Tucked and hidden away-the patio is gorgeous.  The long duck dong Taco is great. The bleek burrito was also great! I do think this place is over priced but I would go again for the environment and the creative menu. The food is good but expensive for Mexican food. Try it out if you haven't !

ds11_DOGpXyxLF0C0xm90A.text: Coolest taco place in town. The outside patio is lined with lights and heaters when it's cold outside. The drinks and tacos here are so good. They run specials every day all day, most of which are drink specials with the exception of Taco Tuesday. On Tuesdays they have two selected tacos on special for two dollars. They make everything in house so food is super fresh. The TRIO is good enough for a meal itself. They even allow dogs on the patio!! The parking is a bit hard to find but contains a lot of parking spaces. Service and vibes are great.

2GcIIp6vBvifUhc0sQP1Nw.text: Great and relaxing atmosphere. Good for solo or group dining. I got two "You're Going The Wrong Way" and it was filling, fresh and flavorful. The sweet tea was okay. Friendly and attentive service. Parking lot where the restaurant is located is small.

nZ2w4z19eksl8yLc-Kgbtg.text: This place truly deserves even more stars then they have! The parking is confusing at first, but if you follow a simple sign out front there is TONS of parking! Don't turn away because people say parking is confusing or difficult. This place has excellent food and drinks.  Everything ordered was so good, and with great service! If I could remember our waiters name, I would give him a personal shoutout. He truly went above and beyond! The outdoor seating is adorable, I'm sure inside is just as nice but wow outside is beautiful!   The margaritas are very good, I had a peach one which was on special and the other order was a regular marg. Very tasty!!   Good was on point, portions were also on point! Huge plates with amazing food. The queso was great, chips were fresh and crispy! Cannot wait to come back and try this place again, going to be hard to not come back every weekend!

photos.caption: Photo of RuRu's Tacos + Tequila - Charlotte, NC, United States. Queso, plain
Photo of RuRu's Tacos + Tequila - Charlotte, NC, United States. Peach margarita
Photo of RuRu's Tacos + Tequila - Charlotte, NC, United States. Steak, peppers, onions, mushrooms quesadilla-amazing!!!

3jcmyLFxfw8obFv7B04ACw.text: I ordered a frozen strawberry margarita. They bring it out, and I ask for a straw and then they tell me they no longer have straws. What the heck - I understand not volunteering straws but to have a full bar and not even carry them? And how am I supposed to drink a frozen margarita in a frozen mug with no straw? It was far too cold to hold. They brought me a spoon for the margarita, which was not ideal. This really hampered my experience, and I NEVER would have ordered a drink had I known there were no straws.   My salad had no dressing yet a mound of sour cream despite the fact I had asked for no dairy. They remade the salad for me. I don't know who wants a cup of sour cream on their salad though?   Please start carrying straws!!

EuP2MfuKeYsVgUhh-4c5QQ.text: Finally visited RuRu's after many recommendations from our friends and it did not disappoint! We got the Three Amigos and substituted the regular queso for the Billy Ray Valentine and everything was delicious! I especially loved the guac--I found it refreshing and fresh tasting--and my boyfriend loved the queso and salsa. We each ordered a couple of tacos to supplement our dips, but honestly would've been fine with just one because we left absolutely stuffed. We both agreed that the Long Duck Dong was the best taco of the bunch. It is Korean-style beef and is scrumptious! I can't wait to go back and try some more. They also have tres leches and churros for dessert, but we were too full to try either. Next time I hope!

bR5cciaoDR-nDp4TqwK8XA.text: I've been to Ruru's 3 times and I have not been disappointed. Food is always so delicious and comes out soooo quickly. Good place for a date night.

lVoEvLc6mdlf3Cscy67cBg.text: The food was not good. Server did not offer any specials for taco Tuesday. The taco shells seemed to be pulled right out of a Mission bag you'd buy in the grocery store. The fat guy in a little coat was the most bland/boring taco I ever ate in my life. The carnitas was dry. The shrimp was awful. Guacamole had too much of a smoky/cumin flavor. It's sad when the tortilla chips are the beat part of the meal.  Won't be back.

K9pRnjMipkuNmr_DrfynUg.text: Really great ambiance but the tacos are meh.  Loveddddd the guacamole though and the portion is huge if you get the appetizer.  Their margaritas are really good too.  Gets really crowded after 6 though so prepare to wait a little while but it's a Fun atmosphere and great for big groups.  Would like to give 3.5 but I'll give 4 since that's not an option

l0LNVZv7eLph1MA_SpLLjw.text: Their menu is just what it says: tacos and tequila. It has a fun energy and a refined appearance all at once. The tacos promised great flavors and ingredients and i was not disappointed. I've had better, but it is definitely worth a try. The sangria was bland but the house margarita was great. Try the "fat guy in a little coat" and the mahi

photos.caption: Photo of RuRu's Tacos + Tequila - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fat guy in a little coat/lookin good louis/long duck dong/ill have what shes having/going the wrong way, stage 5 clinger (not in that order)
Photo of RuRu's Tacos + Tequila - Charlotte, NC, United States

c6CsH_qcgw2sOQajR5Ee7w.text: Love RuRus! Fun atmosphere and fantastic tacos. The Korean tacos are hands down the best. I really hate that chips and salsa aren't complimentary though, and to be honest, they're not worth the $5. The Vote for Pedro drink is great and very spicy. Great for a casual date night!

JzrxZYpm-hpGobCgtlKf6g.text: Great spot for delicious tequila and tacos! Tequila was 1/2 on Thursday . Service was FAST and friendly. Highly recommend!

-lLKcX_aWEnqqzL_VGHTmQ.text: Returned to RuRus for a Mexican GNO!   My girlfriends and I ordered the queso, guacamole, and salsa trio. Everything has silly names here- mostly movie inspired. It's very cheeky!   The trio is ~$15 but seriously a large portion! Their chips are very good and you can tell they are made in house. They aren't overly salted either which is nice.   I ordered the grilled chicken taco and the grilled mahi taco. Each taco is ~$4 give or take depending on the ingredients.   The restaurant is beautiful and gives a sort of old world feel. The patio area outside is one of my favorites in CLT.   Tonight we waited about 30 minutes to be seated for dinner. It was no big deal we sat outside until it started to rain. When we were finally called for our table we waited about 10 minutes before someone came to our table. Service was a little slow to start but our waitress was attentive and sweet.   These are definitely some of my favorite tacos in CLT. Margaritas next time!

photos.caption: Photo of RuRu's Tacos + Tequila - Charlotte, NC, United States

UvqrMJTvXtgL8FueNwNWQQ.text: Y'all this patio is gorgeous! Comfortable seating, a beautiful bar, stunning sky and trees to view, and fun string lights. We pulled into the parking lot and I was impressed with the building itself, like a spanish mansion with a romantic vibe.   I loved the (Its Probably Not Even A Crime These Days) fried Mahi taco with crunchy and tangy slaw, chipotle aioli, so much flavor! I also enjoyed the (Gaylord Focker) veggie taco with roasted cauliflower, fried zucchini, avocado aioli, and more yummy hot pink pickled cabbage, the hot pink color makes for some beautiful photos. Empanadas were ok, I grew up eating them so I'm a little biased, I think they should be served with hot sauce like Valentina instead of the creamy one. Tres Leches cake was lovely, sweet and creamy. Food came out super fast and service was good.   Enjoy reading the menu names, hilarious! Love that they stopped purchasing plastic straws but they need to purchase a eco-friendly alternative. We came on a game night for Panther's football and the restaurant wasn't full, perfect! The game was being shown at the inside and outside bar. This restaurant's interior wasn't as impressive as its outdoors.

-rBmTK6aDASommv-gjKJdA.text: Great food, good service, and good drinks! However, they don't have any straws!! I get it: you're eco-friendly, but then what about metal straws or paper straws?!?! SOMETHING!!! It's very hard to drink a frozen margarita with no straw...:(

y-_jGKp3dERIRtop_ARfNA.text: The best way I can explain RuRu's is "tacos for white charlotteans"  You can have the guacamole/salsa/queso trio, all of which technically what they say they are with little flavor, and then order any of the entree dishes which are all named after Will Ferrell movie lines. The tacos are tacos, which means at worst they're not bad. You can also buy fajitas for 17 dollars.  Like any trendy Charlotte joint - nice building with a cool atmosphere, good place to have a sick jawline and cool faux hawk that blends into a slick beard real smooth. You can look hot here for sure. The after party is at Rosemont bro. Savage.

abKmV9GUp_Wi0nTzvJ9xbw.text: Don't bother coming for food!  If you want drinks and chips and salsa, This might do.   We waited about 20 mins on taco Tuesday; only to be super disappointed. First, our beverage orders were wrong. Fine no big deal. We order both taco specials which was carnitas and fried oyster tacos. I ordered 1 oyster 2 carnitas with corn tortillas, yet  the other order came out the same despite  ordering  differently with different tortillas..: the oysters are clearly on sale because they were old and tasted horrible. And the carnitas had  quite a bit more than normal fat.  We did let them know. They were  not friendly.  Go somewhere else for DINNER for sure.

d236uUXt_qVeCzA2qWq3Iw.text: What a really neat place!  I was lured in from a commercial on the radio which prompted me to check out the website and I LOVED the menu!  The names of the meals, hysterical!!! And the drinks sounded fantastic  So I took my pup after confirming they had a dog friendly patio, donned the sombraro and was not disappointed! I had shared an appetizer of queso and ordered empanadas, and then two tacos.. I did have to get a doggie bag because I couldn't finish everything. I really enjoyed the patio even though it was pretty crowded I got seated quicker than they told me the wait would be. Great atmosphere, I think the patio could have been a little brighter over the tables though. Needed to use my phone flashlight to illuminate the menu. Not that big of a deal overall I will definitely be going again and again

photos.caption: Photo of RuRu's Tacos + Tequila - Charlotte, NC, United States. Feed me tacos and tell me I&#39;m beautiful!

OacMUXh46nTMkeZizxpJ0g.text: This is probably one of the worst dining experiences I've ever had. I went to Ru Ru's last night around 8:30pm. It was little busy but not crazy. We had a 15 minute wait for a table for two inside. The restaurant has nice decor and a very fun atmosphere. I was expecting a great experience. Once we were finally sat, our server came over and took our drink orders pretty quickly. Once she came back with the drinks she asked if we wanted any of the tequila specials and apps. We ordered the basic queso and I got an 1800 tequila upgraded to a margarita per her suggestion. She left quickly even though we were ready to order. She didn't ask. The queso was okay and the margarita had a huge bite and needed more simple syrup or less lime juice. Our queso and drink came in a timely manner. The server came back and asked if we were ready to order. We each ordered TWO tacos. She didn't ask how my drink was or the queso. At this point we were starving. We gave her our order. I figured (due to her leaving quick) that she may have had a lot of tables to serve. This is were it took a huge turn for the worst...  After taking our orders she didn't come back to check on our table at all. She didn't refill our waters or come back to pick up the dishes from the queso. About 10 minutes after we ordered I got her attention while she  was at a nearby table and asked her if my wife could get a refill on her water, which had only ice left. The pitchers of water were literally a few feet away near the entrance to the patio. She said okay and walked off. She never came back. None of the other servers ever came over to check in or refill it either. About 10 minutes after we asked her for the water I just got up and asked another server to please refill it. He did and I went back to my table. At this point it had been 20 minutes since we ordered our food. We were very irritated. Our orders were very simple. No adjustments. Just 2 freaking tacos for each of us. We waited 10 more minutes. At the 30 minute mark I went up the the host and told her we needed our check and never got our food. The server overheard and said "Oh, you never got your food."  No, we didn't and she never came to even check on us. The same guy who refilled our water came over and said we were free to go. Where the heck was the manager?! He asked if we wanted the food to go and we declined. At this point we had been there an hour and it was past 9:30.   I've been a server before and we all make mistakes but to be 1) inattentive, 2) completely ignore a simple request, and 3) never place our food order is completely unacceptable. I can tell from personal experience that this restaurant does not have systems in place to make sure these things don't happen. Please train your staff to 1) work as a team, 2) check back in with guests when they receive their food, 3) run their own food so that they know it's been delivered or to pay attention to their table's tickets, 4) have the manager check in with tables during busy hours to ensure everything is being handled properly, and 5) limit how many tables your server can have because it reduces mistakes. These are the basics of good customer service. We tip well and just wanted a great dinner experience at a new place that we've heard about. We will not be eating here again. It has great potential but they need more customer service training. Super disappointed.

N3BxswuE9Nd55ECDMG78YQ.text: Family favorite restaurant of ours , that serves unique tacos and unique drinks . If you want to be health conscious here, you can. If you want pig out and eat your feelings, get slothed on tequila you can. Or not !!!! You could be classy, and go on a Sunday , choose something different to eat from the brunch menu and have a blackberry mimosa. You can bring a date here, it's a very cozy, romantic-ish decor, plus the music is always good .

Photo of RuRu's Tacos + Tequila - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of RuRu's Tacos + Tequila - Charlotte, NC, United States. This Jalepeno was stuff with cheese and fried . Nuff said.

sd3h2EFxeGxeNlugg04HlA.text: This place has $2 Tacos on Tuesdays (Taco Tuesdays). Nestled in the heart of Myers Park on Providence Rd, RuRu's has a chill and comfortable ambience. Parking can be hard to find, as the lot in front of the restaurant is small, although there are a couple of parking lots closeby within walking distance.   Now, about the food. My go-to is the buffalo chicken taco. The chicken has a good crunch, but the real winner is the buffalo sauce. Tangy and spicy, it goes well with the cheese and sour cream. Pair it with a corona, and you've got a winner.

photos.caption: Photo of RuRu's Tacos + Tequila - Charlotte, NC, United States

8YV_lWR7HpKT0XOeiG9evw.text: RuRu's used to be my family's favorite place to get together for tacos in Charlotte, but sadly after our last visit we won't be returning for a long time. We (8 of us) came in early on a Thursday evening. It was busy, but not overly so. There was really no reason for our waiter to be so rude, but he was. It took about 20-30 minutes to get our main entrees, however we only received half of the orders. It took a full 10 minutes to get the rest. By this time, those that had already received theirs were done eating. By the time the 2nd half of our table received food the bar area was packed and it was so loud we couldn't hear each other without screaming. Needless to say, we were ready to get out of there.

-DkOwy7izwiZ1DP3lIxF4g.text: Great food, mediocre service. The tacos are excellent, as is the drinks selection. The service staff, however, left much to be desired. The server left us waiting 30+ minutes for our drinks and acted like it was an honor for us to be served. The server who delivered the food grunted in monosyllabic, caveman-like tones and shoved our food at us. Recommend the food, but suggest you go to the bar and avoid the wait staff altogether.

58Pf2ooCzGfuLLA5iNKvtg.text: Probably the best "hidden" patio in the Queen City, RuRu's has a lot going for it.  It's just a matter of getting there.  You can see it off the road, but the parking lot is a bit tricky as  you have to whip around the block and park.  I noticed while eating that people came in all disoriented since the host table is located at the back door where the patio is, so if you come in the front door you have to traverse the entire restaurant to see the hostess and get seated.  Food is solid... servers are friendly... however a bit slow.  It's fine if you aren't pressed for time, but when the dining room is half full and you have to flag someone down to get refills and the check, it's a bit disconcerting.  The food has some memorable names and you can tell the kitchen has some creative juices flowing back there.  The main draw would be the tacos, but they have other offerings:  quesadillas, burritos, salads, and rice bowls.  Something for everyone.  Great location in Myers Park, however you need to find it.... If you live in the neighborhood, it's probably best to walk here.  I haven't tried to ride a bike here, but then again I haven't seen any bike parking close-by.

2hPhS8pf2v3TBA_gw7xmfQ.text: Awesome spot! Tucked away in Myer's Park, this place sports a fantastic patio, excellent food, unique and flavorful tacos we decided we're the best tacos ever! Our Mexican friend agrees. ;) The beverages were equally impressive. Try the Poltergeist Mule! And ask for Logan...he was an excellent server!

4JpZlK-_ab2QHTqbnbI7bg.text: Barely even Mexican food. This place is for yuppies.  Margaritas were $9.50 but luckily we went Monday and they were $5.00. Very weak pour. Hostess was uninterested and sat is at a dirty table. Charged for chips and salsa- chips were stale. Guac was good but $9.00!!! Not worth it Hardly any veggie options.  Food was decent but so unauthentic. I've had PB&Js in tortillas that were more Mexican. Service was below average. Nice waitress but seemed to be too busy.  I felt like a sucker for paying for this place. Will not be returning. $45 for two people- nope.

9lOTaVd2c9NcxSYxFX_32g.text: I hate to make one of my first Yelp reviews one with so few positive comments.  But I must say I am very disappointed in my RuRu experience.  I came alone on a Saturday afternoon and service was terribly slow and almost nonexistent.  The food can only be described as mediocre at best.  The queso was the best thing I had and it left much to be desired. I also had the crispy chicken tacos and the Korean steak taco. Both were bland  and the steak was tough.    I will continue to visit Bakersfield for my taco and tequila fix.

YiKSoTkhc1UYnPj4ReLpbA.text: Ruru's has great Mexican food, good customer service, and a tucked away intimate location. I was very impressed with our server, Rico, and their guacamole is out of this world! I got so full on guacamole that I ordered the small "Bend and Snap" salad and was completely satisfied.   Ruru's supports Charlotte's local breweries and, much to my delight, serves Birdsong's Jalapeno Pale Ale which pairs masterfully with Mexican food!   The only down side of Ruru's is that they're kind of hard to find. I was able to snag a parking spot in the front lot, but quite honestly don't have a clue how to find the secret back parking lot. I'll worry about that on another day!  Ruru's also has a fabulous patio, but it was 1,000+ degrees last night so we didn't get to sit outside. I vow to return in cooler weather to find the secret back parking lot and enjoy patio dining.   Ruru's is quite a little gem nestled discretely in Myers Park!

photos.caption: Photo of RuRu's Tacos + Tequila - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of RuRu's Tacos + Tequila - Charlotte, NC, United States

hIy0_MnT2rrbln20yejrLA.text: Great spot for some margaritas and tacos on the patio. The margaritas are some of the best I have had in Charlotte. The frozen margs remind me of an island oasis drink machine - very fine texture.   Tacos are great, but I need 3 for a meal. The house beans are what really shine for me - I order them every time.   The burritos are also good, nothing mind blowing - but tasty.   I wish there were some combo entrees - the a la carte menu leaves me hungry or with a steep bill.

L-2kUUb1Q6zhueAOqGLfXw.text: The place has a great setting and patio but didn't execute given the assets in place. More time should be spent adding taste to the food Instead of concocting corny names for the menu items. Chips were stale. Salsa was good, not great. Chicken for fajitas was legit but rest of items on the plate were bland.   Service ranges from inconsistent to inattentive. But friendly. Just seemed the management and processes were lacking.   Given the cool patio setting, it should be one of the most festive environments around but the strange house music selections made it awkward.   Margaritas: the spicy one was too sweet. The frozen house margarita was better.   This place could be a winner if they get it together , if not, it's just an also ran with a high rent payment.

kgKcSVe2FtV7kf3NVfFvlQ.text: This place was a joke. If you want better Mexican go to Taco Bell. The pictures posted are way way bigger servings than what You REALLY get. Dinner Beware.

photos.caption: Photo of RuRu's Tacos + Tequila - Charlotte, NC, United States. This was ALL THE MEAT in 3 three empanadas !!!! What a rip.

7z_Xh0I1h5MhN9dFxml9Fg.text: I am going to start by reminding you that I am not a Chef. I have though, eaten in some of the best restaurants in the US. And....my mother cooks for my daughter and I, Hispanic Soul food almost every night (yes, be jealous). I went to RuRu's on a Sunday with my girls to catch up. We are a great big happy bunch. We don't look for faults we are looking for a good time being that we are all mommys and we need it! RuRu's had an amazing selection of Tequilas (for being a little Charlotte Restaurant). Their drinks though(specifically my strawberry margarita) reminded me of a drink that I would get served in club. You know...the grown drink. That is not necessarily bad...but..who wants to be grown while drinking a Margarita?! Ok, fine. Move on to the appetizers. We ordered the Queso with Chorizo (Queso: watery with kind of a corner filled with chorizo grease). Tasty but not impressed. And the nachos with no meat. Super Duper plain. Ok fine. So I asked our server which was his favorite Taco. He said the Korean duck something. Ok, cool. Let me try it.  This is where I have a problem. This is obviously and "upscale" Mexican/bar/restaurant...I asked for a corn tortilla. Obviously, these are bought at the Harris Teeter down the corner because they weren't fresh nor hand made, which is very easy to do. The duck tasted extra sweet and like marinated flank steak. Ok, fine. I asked him later to bring me the Mahi Mahi with cilantro and pineapple. I imagined a seared Mahi marinated, tangy, lime, fresh pineapple...Nope. This tasted/ look like two small pieces of fried tenders to fit in the very tasteless corn tortilla with a couple of tiny pieces of plain pineapple and a bunch of cilantro. Common guys!!!! It's not that hard to get tacos right? A fancy name to a taco doesn't mean quality....Ok fine. I had fun with my girls..but...not coming back. I suggest you watch the Episode of a Chef's Table on Netflix featuring the Mexican Chef and his journey to make the perfect taco with original ingredients. Inspiring and NOT HARD!

Ck-I4yBZOvn640QyEykE-w.text: We ventured to RuRu's this evening on our way to visit the Mint Museum. I love the old Spanish style building, the stucco, red tiles, bright umbrellas on the patio...reminds me of my days in Miami in Coral Gables. The menu was simple which was nice because some Tex-Mex places go overboard with their offerings. We started with the chips and salsa. The chips were warm, salsa was chunky and flavorful. If you're dining with little people like I tend to, the salsa is kid friendly but packs a nice flavor. For dinner, my kids ordered tacos and a quesadilla which were generous in size. The kids meals include a drink...the quesadilla was $5 and the tacos were 2/$6. I ordered three tacos ($4-$4.75 each) and my husband ordered a rice bowl (about $9) My tacos could have been more flavorful and they would have tasted better on corn tortillas. The service was excellent. Our server was friendly and attentive. We will definitely be back sans kids for a date night because the drink menu looked amazing. Next time I'll order the rice bowl (It was so good!)

pO6EBV0jUOA2cRKj9P6nbQ.text: Amazing tacos.. They came out pretty quick. First time here and the food was on point.

photos.caption: Photo of RuRu's Tacos + Tequila - Charlotte, NC, United States

gL1nwgUBDzq2DyFItVmR7Q.text: My favorite Mexican joint in Charlotte. This is located in Myers Park around the Providence/Queens Rd area. Back side of Stagioni. The food is great, tacos come by themselves and no side. Things like fried oyster tacos are a home run. The patio is hands-down one of the coolest in town. Parking can be tough.

b6I-KqrB4BifbeLyuGD3aA.text: Ru Ru's is a great place to come and relax after a long work day!  The patio is fairly large with open seating. The food is consistent but they cocktails and specials are my favorite part. If you're looking for a good place to get together with friends ( or by yourself!) Ru Ru's is always a solid choice to go and unwind!

xLt0FfL_j3gikjtTk61Xzg.text: First time sitting down and having lunch there. I have been before for cocktails and apps at the bar. I couldn't believe they do not serve chips and salsa when you sit down, you have to pay for it. I know its "Myers Park" but for the price of the food that they charge they need to give you chips and salsa. I asked for salsa when they served my lunch and I was charged $1.50 for a very small bowl. I dont like to be nickled and dimed and thats what it felt like.  I ordered the chicken quesadilla which was $12.00 and no sides. Expensive for a quesadilla but i will say it was very good. I'm not sure if I will go back. There are several other mexican restaurants that are just as good more food and less expensive.

w2AVsNVrV-hX6qAgIOMkdA.text: Oh. My. Gosh. My life is in NYC but this is my new favorite place to eat Mexican food. First, I Judge all Mexican restaurants by the salsa and it was so good here I could have just had salsa for dinner. Be warned. They don't give you chips and salsa for free. It's okay. Because they were the bomb. Guac on point.  Great food. Great atmosphere.

Dlk8ae2-BAwRiqGZTHw--A.text: Best place in Charlotte. The steak burrito called The Clarence Beeks is better than any food on this planet and I will fight you if you argue with me. It's close to my house and I go about once a week. Even limped there with a broken leg a couple months ago. There will always be a loud bachelorette party or a girls' night there, but that adds to the greatness of this place. My #1 favorite restaurant, no joke.

Q_rT1CQdGuuhbCXD9MuNaQ.text: This is one of our favorite places but last night was a complete disappointment. The beer and Jalapeno Infused Margarita were the highlights. Our Queso Dip was just warm but I decided to ignore that. We ordered the Shrimp Fajitas, maybe my expectations were too high, but no sizzling plate. There was no flavor at all to the dish. I rechecked the menu and it did say SEASONED SHRIMP.  My seven shrimp were as white as could be with no sight of seasoning anywhere. My wife couldn't eat it so she ordered the Chicken Burrito. Our daughter had ordered this before and enjoyed it so it seemed like a safe bet. WRONG! Another Luke warm flavorless dish. The ratio of chicken to rice was won by the RICE!  Out of 10......Chicken 2...Rice 8!! I told our waiter Luka who said he would tell the kitchen but I never heard anything more.  I'm sure we will be back, after a while, but it'll just be Tacos!

photos.caption: Photo of RuRu's Tacos + Tequila - Charlotte, NC, United States. Tofu Taco!!
Photo of RuRu's Tacos + Tequila - Charlotte, NC, United States. Trio dips with chips..

ZbeYLPRhByo1N2DuCzCj3A.text: Coming from California, we were worried about finding delicious tacos, guacamole, margaritas....  RuRu's was an incredible and wonderful surprise. The food and atmosphere were equally delightful. And the banes of the dishes and drinks are so clever I had to take photos of the menu. Highly recommend!

Ws37zZNpmcIgeDXBhp-wrQ.text: I can't believe it's taken me so long to come here. I really had a good experience. I love the menu, there are so many options to choose from. I like all of the entree names sine they are named after movie or television lines, very creative.   The guacamole was soooo good. I also loved the margarita. It was so refreshing and delicious. The staff was friendly and although they were very busy, they were still courteous and quick with making drinks and taking orders.   I love the bar and patio area. Despite the small appearance on the outside, it's actually a pretty big place. There is a parking lot, but it gets really packed and the spaces are extremely tight.

photos.caption: Photo of RuRu's Tacos + Tequila - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of RuRu's Tacos + Tequila - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of RuRu's Tacos + Tequila - Charlotte, NC, United States

8G5r1GhnK3owx_yVVK3f9Q.text: Food: The food was pretty good, overall the basic Mexican food that you would get at a Mexican restaurant. The tacos were also good my sister said one of them in particular was really spicy but she still liked it. I got a large burrito called Death by RuRu's and it was great, the chicken was a bit dry but overall had good flavor. I recommend it to anyone who like classic Mexican food.  Service: Everyone was very friendly, I didn't have any negative experiences with any of the staff. The employees were smiling and being extremely nice throughout the whole service, and I was with quite a large group.   Inside Restaurant: The environment was great with the music and lights. It's a very positive and cheerful environment. Really good for date nights or outing with your family. There was also live music at the time I arrived and it brought the whole place to life. (The bathrooms were clean and kept up pretty nicely as well).   Overall the reason I only gave 3 stars was because the environment outshined the food in my opinion, although the food tasted pretty good it wasn't AMAZING.  But if you enjoy Mexican food with an American twist then you should enjoy this place very much.

photos.caption: Photo of RuRu's Tacos + Tequila - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shrimp Fajita
Photo of RuRu's Tacos + Tequila - Charlotte, NC, United States. Death by Ruru
Photo of RuRu's Tacos + Tequila - Charlotte, NC, United States. Taco

VTS_xjm9Wye4CLuna32tLw.text: Service was exceptional especially on a busy taco Tuesday. Our waiter was amazing and kept coming back to check on us despite all the tables he had to handle.   I got the buffalo chicken which was the fired on your day off I believe and I got a get off my lawn. Both were very delicious and super fresh when they came out. I also got the I am mclovin which was also really good!!  The only downfall was finding parking, it's a lot going on around the building which was also a little hard to find since the signage isn't that big but I needed up parking across the street.

photos.caption: Photo of RuRu's Tacos + Tequila - Charlotte, NC, United States. Get off my lawn and fired on your day off

ZCq7-m5pgwtTAOjBcfuJlg.text: This place is pretty good but most of what makes it great is the physical building and not necessarily the food. The drinks are so so and they charge for chips and salsa. All together an okay place that is priced like it's a very good place (probably necessary to keep up with rent in the area). They could go a long way with a better house margarita and not being too stingy to give out a basket of chips.

photos.caption: Photo of RuRu's Tacos + Tequila - Charlotte, NC, United States. What comes with steak fajitas
Photo of RuRu's Tacos + Tequila - Charlotte, NC, United States. Steak fajitas

Ppdq4dyDQA8GeIoGTVAQAw.text: Awesome Mexican and taco spot with creative menu item names! The patio is one of the best in Charlotte (especially at night) and the menu has over 15 different tacos all for right around $4 (they're a great size too). Arguably the best tacos I've had in Charlotte here and the Margaritas are great and are only $5 on Mondays. The only thing that stands out here warranting the 4 stars is that the chips and salsa isn't free (a big thing that stands out to a lot of people). Not only is it not free, but you're charged in full if you get more on top of what they bring when you first order it. While it's great salsa (with lots of full chunks), it's still something that most places wouldn't charge for which can add an extra $5+ to your meal. Overall, a great spot though!

photos.caption: Photo of RuRu's Tacos + Tequila - Charlotte, NC, United States

K_VpZdxeEsCPrpF5hJJeKQ.text: Great spot with good service, good food and good drinks.  Lunch deal is buy 2 tacos get 1 free.  Heads up, they are straw free, don't even have paper ones.   Awesome patio and bar outside. Menu is all named from funny movie quotes so that makes ordering entertaining.  Tacos are good and the service is great too. Always have had a good experience!

photos.caption: Photo of RuRu's Tacos + Tequila - Charlotte, NC, United States. It was the dukes, looking good Louis and I&#39;ll have what she&#39;s having tacos

UBIEzQeFuVKlstLrLxp0xg.text: My brother chose Ruru's because he wanted to try something different. Before I review the food I want to start off by saying that the building that the restaurant is located in is beautiful. It's a Tuscan /Spanish architecture type of building. Now on to the food and service my brother and I were quickly greeted and seated. The menu has vegetarian options which is a plus. I decided on " I love the smell of Nepalm" which is the vegetable fajitas with tofu. The entree was good but it wasn't anything that stood out to me entirely. Also, this place is different in the sense that chips and salsa aren't offered on the house. The food is also a tad overpriced. Our server was friendly and checked in on us frequently. Would I go back again just based on the food alone? Probably not but this place is worth a try.

photos.caption: Photo of RuRu's Tacos + Tequila - Charlotte, NC, United States. I love the smell of Napalm.

7V3LH3W-xX5rcTSIpLBRrg.text: RuRu's has some of the best Mexican food in Charlotte that we've had. Their guacamole was very fresh and their tacos were great. What really put it over the top was their quiet patio that made it perfect for a late afternoon lunch and drinks!   We got regular beef tacos and then a carnitas taco and "I'll have what she's having" grilled mahi speciality tacos. We both really liked the specialty tacos!

U2qRWLLcGCXdJrSinqQxyw.text: Walking in I loved the decor and the set up. There were lots of good vibes and smiling faces. However that came to a halt after reviewing the menu. I had my hopes high because colleagues of mine would rave about their taco Tuesday's but I was a quite disappointed in the lack of non-meat taco options and entrees that they had. I ended up trying the "that's not snowflake" and the "Gaylord Focker". Both tacos were very unique I just wished they would add more seafood and vegan options to the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of RuRu's Tacos + Tequila - Charlotte, NC, United States. That&#39;s not snowflak on the left and Gaylord Focker on the right with a magic mike drink

7SRgycQY1czXEprcWhcnJw.text: This place was in the cutest little shopping center. I wish it had been a nicer night because their patio looked so nice.  We had queso and salsa- both great and not too spicy, I honestly do not love queso but here it was amazing. I had 2 ground beef tacos and yum I wish I had ordered like 7 more. Pretty cheap eat!! Will definitely be back next time I'm in Charlotte!

Photo of RuRu's Tacos + Tequila - Charlotte, NC, United States. Salsa

QjIwFL_0laGWAufyi_YqUw.text: Honestly the BEST Mexican food in Charlotte!!! I've tried many different places but the food is always subpar. However, RuRu's was a different story. The food was outstanding and seasoning was phenomenal!!! They even had some fun names for all of their food and drinks. We went on a Thursday and they had half off all tequila and margs for $3 extra and buy two tacos get one free! Atmosphere was very laid back and photogenic. They have outdoor seating and allow cats and dogs. We brought a dog and they even gave her a dog bowl full of water. Not sure why this place has 3.5 stars but they deserve far more! This is for sure my new fave spot for Mexican food. Food pictured: "I am McLovin" chips and queso (my favorite part of this meal), Tacos: "I'll have what she's having", "Fat guy in a little coat" and "Long duck dong".

photos.caption: Photo of RuRu's Tacos + Tequila - Charlotte, NC, United States

3ydBCnu9gdGBaxdm5GOZxg.text: I love their tacos here. They are so filling and delicious!  The flavors mix so well together. My fave is the Long Duck Dong. I've heard it's their most popular every time I order it, lol. I gave them four stars because I had their chips and salsa and their salsa tastes like store-bought instead of house-made. I'll definitely come back and try their other items though since their tacos are so good!

photos.caption: Photo of RuRu's Tacos + Tequila - Charlotte, NC, United States

hwT6u6-t6KXtfHWsTWqOGQ.text: I would give this place a 4.5 if I could!  The tacos were yummy with so many crazy delicious choices, prices were very reasonable, and service was fast.  Would for sure go again!

8BqA5Cu-GgNSfyxDGSDXTA.text: Headed here for Taco Tuesday with a friend and it was great.   Luckily it was a pretty decent night outside so we were able to sit outside on the patio. The patio area was very warm, inviting, and they had heaters out there.   I got 2 of the $2 tacos which for that night was a pork one and a meatball one. I also got another which was $3 or $4 and it had fried chicken in it and some other delicious stuff. The only thing I thought was a rip off was the margarita I got. It was $8 or 9 and honestly was so small to me... (given I was comparing this to just going to a regular mom and pop hispanic place and how BIG their margaritas are for the same price). However, the tacos were great and filling and a good size. They had some really neat flavor combos. All of the other stuff on the menu besides tacos looked yum and I noticed healthier options too.   I would definitely head back there and check them out if you haven't already

photos.caption: Photo of RuRu's Tacos + Tequila - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of RuRu's Tacos + Tequila - Charlotte, NC, United States

OilZm94RNGmPZazQ0zpQZQ.text: Tonight we had a spontaneous date night to RuRu's and it honestly blew me away,  we started with chips and salsa (pictures below) and kicked the dinner off with some tasty margarita's which were $5 on mondays!  Being our first time there we decided to just pick tacos at random, and OMG...these tacos blew our minds...The explosion of flavor that hit you just instantly took you to that special place (haha) as I finished my tacos I said "these are the best tacos in Charlotte" this is my new hangout and can't wait to go back and try it again! If your looking to impress a date or just go pig out on some amazing food, we highly recommend this place!

NWt_qlHznk7cNAZvOYIG6A.text: We visited for a late lunch on a Saturday. The ambiance is very nice and clean. We ordered the queso which was creamy, but no spicy. My husband ordered a quesadilla and it was a great portion, he wasn't even able to eat it all. I ordered the fat guy in a small coat, and the ground beef taco. Both were excellent! The house margarita was delicious and hit the spot! Great service too. We will be back!

fhImAxJuw9cW08BRyE3E7g.text: Let me start by saying I have been to this restaurant many times and normally I would rate it 4 stars. Tonight it was crowded but that is not unusual, the tacos were great as usual but a little dry. I asked for a side of simple salsa, delivered, nothing special for this type of restaurant. They charged me $1.50 for the very small condiment sized salsa, are you kidding me? Second, I ordered an extra Taco, it never came and no one noticed until after dessert my server mentioned did I ever get it, I asked them to cancel!! Management came by to apologize which I appreciate but the damage was done customer wise. I think RuRu's has done better but a few of these experiences will change the popularity of this place quickly with customers for sure, hoping in the future I will a better experience assuming I come by!

photos.caption: Photo of RuRu's Tacos + Tequila - Charlotte, NC, United States

pFVNYHlDlOvme36Z1rM1rw.text: I'm going to start this by saying something controversial: I'm not the biggest fan of this genre of food. I know, I know..I cry myself to sleep over this. These tacos were amaze-balls. Like I would make this a usual spot kind of amaze-balls. Also the calamari is bomb.com. SO GOOD. If you are really hungry order 3 tacos. Mildly hungry order 3 tacos. They are that good. Ambiance is super cute, very chill. Good spot for date night.

U47fO-y0VOR-9WL_Mpr6gA.text: I met a friend for lunch at RuRu's. It was our first time here. Overall impression: Nice patio for sunny days. Good margaritas. Just ok tacos.  Parking can be hard to find. There is a small parking lot on Providence and a larger parking lot behind the building that's a little hard to find. I recommend parking in the lot off of Fenton Pl. and walking in thru the patio area. The hostess puts your name on the list and asks for your cell phone number so they can text you when your table is ready.   We had chips and salsa, the You Talkin to Me margarita, and a la carte tacos.   The Fat Guy in a Little Coat taco ($4.29) was ok. It had a weird sauce on it that tastes more like mayonnaise than avocado aioli. The sauce was off putting.  The Slappin the Bass taco ($4.29) was ok. There was a LOT of breading on the fish (more breading than fish). I removed half of the breading before eating.   It seems to be a popular place, but I think I'll continue my search for great tacos in Charlotte.

KyjfdIfXRriaAiPg6ZCk2A.text: Some of the best tacos in Charlotte, just saying.  I went during lunch hours and got the buy 2 tacos and get 1 free deal.  These tacos are so big that I could have done only 2 tacos, but why not enjoy an extra one on the house?  I got the I'll Have What She's Having, Stage Five Clinger, and Fat Guy in a Little Coat tacos.  All 3 tacos were packed with flavor.   My favorite was I'll Have What She's Having.  The Mahi Mahi mixed with the sweet and fruity pineapple salsa really hit the spot.  All the protein was cooked to perfection and the toppings were crisp and fresh.  The only down side is they don't have free chips and salsa :(

xsR_--GZM1zoKLPAjFt4Rg.text: Great deck on the back of the restaurant /w a bar. On of the best patio/decks in Charlotte IMO.   Food has always been good the dozen or so times I've been there're. It is priced reasonably and the service has been good each time we have visited.

qXYThI2w8Mpm9D9swIVLHw.text: Talk about a patio at this great taco place!  So many good reasons to love this hot spot. First and foremost I find the food to be absolutely delicious and very reasonable for the quality!  I have to say I keep wanting to try something other than tacos but I like them too much!  I have had a side salad which was very well topped and prepared.   Patio on fleek!  This place has a nice balance of shaded areas for lunch, and cool light strings across in the evening. The outdoor bar gazebo is also very large. The inside is nice as well, though the patio is where it's at if the weather is cooperative.   The staff is always very friendly and service is pretty quick once you are seated. The drinks are also very good here I must say. And of course the names of both the drinks and the meals are very unique.   Finally, make sure to take note of the parking lot off Fenton Place and tell your first time friends meeting you there. The address location being Providence Rd and having that small lot in the front makes it a bit tricky your first time at the Ru.

photos.caption: Photo of RuRu's Tacos + Tequila - Charlotte, NC, United States. Patio is the spot to be!
Photo of RuRu's Tacos + Tequila - Charlotte, NC, United States. Great night for the patio!

MfMppE8eJq9BWMwkLlpkng.text: We came to Ru Ru's on Sunday and left with an A-OK experience!  Absolutely love the patio here! Fortunately we were able to grab a seat on the patio. It was a bit disappointing when it started to rain and no one working there even offered to help move people. Fortunately, my husband and a nice guy sitting next to us moved some umbrellas around to cover us. In retrospect, it was actually kind of nice dining in the rain.   Love the menu....everything is named from movie quotes, which is just so fun. I learned that my movie knowledge is very limited cause I was struggling with naming the movie!  Anywho, both my husband and I got the Noda Gordgeous.....I know it's not fall yet, but man, that drink is good!!   This isnt one of those places that they just immediately bring you out some salsa. We decided to go with the Billy Ray Valentine, which is a chorizo queso dip. Decent size portion and pretty tasty.....that dish definitely was definitely empty by the end of the nide. We also decided to split 3 tacos: Snowflake, I'll have what she's having, and the shrimp one. They came out super super quick. The Snowflake was not my favorite....i think it may have had a little too much sauce on it cause that is all i tasted. Crazy enough, it was my husbands favorite. Agree to disagree. The shrimp was pretty good. However, the I'll Have What She's Having was rock on solid. The fruit in it made the taco!  I really hate to talk about service because I think waiters and waitresses are truly some of the hardest working people ever and get very little credit. However, service was very off. Things forgotten, wrong items brought out, super slow. Honestly, I am totally ok with off service (as we are all human and have bad days) but there wasn't even a recognition of/apology the forgotten/wrong items and slowness. Unfortunately, the couple beside us was complaining too.   All in all, it was a pretty good experience.   I know you guys are trying to be a "nice" Mexican place, but pretty pretty please get some free chips and salsa in the mix and I'll be a happy camper!

C5fWB9rr2Rl_Lwut6l-Cyw.text: Beware of their tricky specials!!! My wife and I went on national tequila day and we were told that all drinks with tequila are half off. We were also told that all tacos were two dollars on Tuesdays. when we got our check, we were charged full price for all tacos and drinks. Over $100 for 2 guests. When we brought this to the managers attention, he told us that the drinks are half off only for the tequila that is in the drink not for the whole drink!! Really!!!  He continued to say that they only had two feature tacos for two dollars. He did not offer to make it good in anyway. Disappointed in the lack of service and misrepresentation. Food was not all that good. The server told us that they're trying to save the planet so no straws were offered! Red lipstick on the water glasses!! Definitely not washed properly WOW!!! Just an overall disappointment we won't go back.

wVLnih_kuFIhi-J-NyPe4g.text: This is one of my favorite places to eat. It can be a little pricy at times because there's generally not a really good drink special but the drinks are always good and the tacos are great. I definitely suggest the fat guy in a little coat taco.

photos.caption: Photo of RuRu's Tacos + Tequila - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of RuRu's Tacos + Tequila - Charlotte, NC, United States

EvHvOCxddbxtc94UGaCIIA.text: OMG good.   I haven't had the chance to go to Ru Ru's in person but I have ordered it a few times on a food delivery app. The food quality is above par and the delicious taste is a direct reflection of the quality ingredients used during preparation. The presentation is colorful and makes a big difference in my overall experience with Ru Ru's.  I'm from California and am pleasantly surprised with the quality and taste of Mexican food in Charlotte. I highly recommend it. My favorite items are the Quesadillas.

uPfD2W9qW-zq-z3GCn-XjQ.text: If you're looking for some great tacos, drinks and atmosphere, this is your place. This was my first time going and I will definitely be back. They have a great patio and even had live music when I was there on Wednesday.   The tres amigos appetizer is a great started along with anyone of their craft cocktails or great selection of beers.   Any one of their tacos are great too and definitely can't go wrong with any of the selections.

ztmdf2mdEn_Z-DSi_53etA.text: Yessssss! This will be my next to go to place. Came on a Monday. Rainy weather kept us from sitting on their patio, but the $5 drinks kept us warm. Love the menu item names! Lots of 80s movie themes. Drinks - that's a pretty purse is the truth!!!! Got the Lunch appetizer special. 2 dips for $8. Got queso and guacamole, very good and fresh. Had 2 servers....they were both knowledgeable, Jonathan was our main server. We had 2 tacos: I had Uncle Buck and Long Duck Dong(great sauce). He had fat guy in a little coat and looking good louis. All good choices. Will return!

6aByELAyo_q7aG1ZT6DtMQ.text: So glad we decided to give this place a try. It's only rated at 3.5 stars here on Yelp but it's totally a 5. One of the best places I've been to since my move to the area in April. You'll want to try the long duck dong taco, it's incredible.
